title.narrative: Provision of life-saving primary health care services and vital public health interventions for the South Sudanese refugees in Sudan

description.narrative: The main objective is to enhance access to life-saving PHC and referral services. UNICEF will use CERF funds to 1) distribute emergency medicines, medical supplies, basic health kits, and laboratory reagents, 2) implement vaccination campaigns against measles and other diseases in cooperation with SMoH and local NGOs and 3) provide medical services, including immunization at entry points, to vulnerable refugees through the SMoH and NGO partners. 120,000 refugees in Khartoum, South Kordofan and White Nile will benefit from this support for 6 months.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Provision of life-saving primary health care services and vital public health interventions for the South Sudanese refugees in Sudan

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS SUDAN RAPID RESPONSE DISPLACEMENT 2014

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
